case_title: ABDUL JABBAR and 180 others vs SECRETARY, HEALTH DEPARTMENT, GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and others
respondents: SECRETARY, HEALTH DEPARTMENT, GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN and others
key_issues: Cancellation of appointments without due process
Violation of natural justice and equity
Failure to issue show-cause notices or conduct hearings
relief_prayed: Reinstatement of appellants in service from the date of termination (24-4-2014) with all benefits.

facts.reason_for_termination: Appointments deemed illegal and void ab initio based on Inquiry Committee recommendations.

appellants: Appointments made following Departmental Selection Committee recommendations.
Termination conducted arbitrarily without explanation or proper procedure.
Violation of Balochistan Employees Efficiency and Discipline Act, 2013.
respondents: Appointments made on the basis of favoritism, nepotism, and influence.
Failure to observe applicable rules and requisite formalities.

violations: Principle of natural justice (audi alteram partem) grossly violated.
Non-issuance of notice before cancellation of appointment orders.
precedents_cited: Mst. Maryam Yunus v. Director of Education PLD 1990 SC 666
Secretary to Government of N.-W.F.P. Zakat/Social Welfare Department, Peshawar v. Sadullah Khan 1996 SCMR 413
Syed Sikandar Ali Shah v. Auditor-General of Pakistan 2002 SCMR 1124
Province of Punjab v. Zulfiqar Ali 2005 PLC (C.S.) 1165
Pakistan International Air Lines Corporation v. Shehzad Farooq Malik 2004 SCMR 158
judgment_summary.decision: Impugned order dated 24-4-2014 set aside. Appellants reinstated in service without back-benefits to face de novo inquiry proceedings.

instructions.respondents: Conduct de novo proceedings against appellants in accordance with law/rules (BEEDA) within four months.
